notes: 5 business days response with one 10-day extension allowed. Appeals to head of public body, then circuit court. Attorney General publishes FOIA handbook.

basic_request.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request
basic_request.body:
Dear FOIA Coordinator:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, MCL 15.231 et seq., I respectfully request access to inspect and copy the following public records:

[SPECIFIC DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS]

Please respond to this request within 5 business days as required by MCL 15.235. If you need additional time, please notify me in writing of the reason for extension and new due date within the initial 5-day period.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide written notice citing the specific exemption under MCL 15.243 and explaining why it applies.

I prefer to receive responsive records electronically when possible to minimize costs. Please provide a detailed fee estimate if charges will exceed $50.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]

appeal_template.subject: FOIA Appeal - Denial of Public Records Request
appeal_template.body:
Dear [HEAD OF PUBLIC BODY]:

I am appealing the denial of my Michigan Freedom of Information Act request dated [DATE]. On [DATE], your office denied my request for [DESCRIPTION OF RECORDS] citing [EXEMPTION CLAIMED].

I believe this denial is improper under Michigan law because [LEGAL REASONING]. The requested records should be disclosed under MCL 15.231 et seq.

I request that you reverse this denial and provide the requested records. If you uphold the denial, please provide a detailed explanation of your reasoning.

I reserve the right to seek judicial review in circuit court if this appeal is denied.

Sincerely,
[YOUR NAME]
[YOUR ADDRESS]
[PHONE NUMBER]
[EMAIL ADDRESS]
